duties_responsibilities.duty: Set up and operate basic / small-scale audiovisual systems in a hospitality environment.
Preset / stage equipment for evening /outdoor events.
Testing / troubleshooting installed AV in classrooms for functionality and Hybrid meeting AV use.
Float classrooms / help attendees with AV needs.
Participate in monthly inventory counts / replenish storage rooms / classroom bins.
Provide kick off / trouble shooting support for classrooms (installed AV) – Face to face client support.
Set / strike flip charts, small portable monitors, etc.
Clean classroom glass walls (white boards).
Plug “smart” tables into floor pockets.
Prep training classrooms for the next day.
Set / kick off / strike moon balloons and small audio systems for outdoor events.
Running power lines / power strips to classroom & ballroom tables.
Strive to exceed the expectations and needs of internal and external customers.
Maintains a positive relationship with all clients through effective communication.
Monitors events and checks in on customers throughout the day.
Understands the technical aspects of the job and demonstrates basic operational ability to troubleshoot and problem solve with equipment and software issues.
Understands company processes, follows procedures and completes systems entry and paperwork accurately.
Uses the equipment sheets to determine the equipment scheduled for set up and for strike.
Increases revenue by utilizing floor up-selling techniques.
Works with clients to finalize invoices.
Completes order entries in Navigator, as needed.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma required. Associate’s degree is preferred. Achieve Technical Level 3 Certification per Encore Technical Skillset Matrix within 180 days. 1 year of customer service or hospitality experience is preferred. 1 year of audio visual experience or equivalent in educational environment is preferred. A valid driver’s license is required for team members that may operate Company vehicles.
